intro: Pimpinella crispa, commonly known as the fringed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release tiny seeds. Pimpinella crispa is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
